bioghist.p: Louis A. Kazal (Ph.D. in Biochemistry, Rutgers University) joined the Department of Physiology at Jefferson Medical College in 1957. He headed the Plasma Fractionation Unit of Jefferson's Cardeza Foundation for Hematological Research. Prior to that he was a research biochemist at the Merck Sharp & Dohme Pharmaceutical Corporation. His research involved the chemistry and biophysics of blood coagulation and erythropoiesis. At Jefferson he presented lectures on the physiology of coagulation, developed laboratory exercises in coagulation, and engaged in and supervised graduate student research in coagulation and erythropoiesis. He retired from Jefferson in 1978.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of records of Kazal's work at Jefferson Medical College (1956-1978). Materials include: reports and correspondence relating to research on plasma fractionation, coagulation inhibitor studies, anticoagulent activity of gastric juices, and fibrinogen precipitation. The collection also includes binders of experiment data sheets and charts, reprints of Kazal's articles, copies of student papers, and administrative documents and correspondence.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
